page.title: 07STANDING STONES
page.content: In our area there are a number of standing stones which are concentrated in a certain area.These stones are not however standing stones as such but, although they stand approximately 2.25metres high are in fact field markers. The area in which they are concentrated was the old Springfield estate. The stones are marked "SPRINGFIELD" followed by a number. The number refers to the number of the field on the estate plan. The stones were erected c. 1850. Local talk has it that the stones were erected as scratching posts for cattle and the writing on the stones was only secondary. Perhaps this is enhanced by the size of the stones as they appear to be rather elborate for field markers.
